headline: Feds Cannot Bypass States and Courts
author: MJA
sentences: After the Trump administration enacted an updated version in 2019, the Department of Justice successfully fought the far Left’s challenges in four circuit courts of the country, allowing the Rule to remain in place pending the Supreme Court’s hearing of the case.

Today, I will be arguing before the U.S. Supreme Court to uphold Arizona’s right to defend the Public Charge Rule, which requires noncitizens to financially support themselves in order to become U.S. citizens or to obtain green cards.

Just as I argued Brnovich v. DNC last year to uphold Arizona’s commonsense election integrity measures, this case is about preserving a long-held cornerstone of responsible and sustainable immigration policy for the United States.
This rule is necessary to avoid an unfair drain on welfare and public assistance programs throughout the states.
The Public Charge Rule has existed in some form for over 100 years in our country.
